In including mode only notifications from the apps that are selected will sent to Pebble. In excluding mode all notifications will be sent to Pebble except those from applications selected.
Global filter by keywords/regular expressions for notifications that should be included/excluded from displaying.
Global filter by keywords/regular expressions for notifications that should be included/excluded from displaying.

In this window you can define replacement pairs. Notification Center will swap specified characters with specified text. Use that to remove or translate characters that Pebble does not display to readable text.
You need to enter one character or unicode code for it!
No dictionary files found.\n\nPlace your replacement dictionary .txt files into NotificationCenter folder on your phone\'s storage and try again.

In this view you can disable Notification Center when specific app is open on Pebble. It is useful to prevent NC from interrupting apps like sleep tracking or stopwatch. You can also switch to native Pebble notifications which means many NC features won\'t work, but it also won\'t close currently running app. For this feature to work, you need to enable Developer Connection Pebble app settings.
Error while loading app list. Is your Pebble connected and Developer Connection enabled?
Do you really want to clear whole notification history?
Opening Pebble app failed. Do you have Pebble app installed?
Do you want to open Pebble App Store to install Notification Center to your Pebble?
Open NC in Pebble App Store
Use default settings for that app
If checked, bottom settings won\'t be in effect and this app will use default settings
Send notifications that are not just one time event, but something ongoing (for example ongoing file download or app instalation)
When checked, NC will also send completely blank notifications from this app
When this is checked and new notification comes from this app, it will switch to that notification instead of queuing it.
When checked and you dismiss notification on the phone, it will also disappear on the Pebble. Only works on Android 4.3 and newer.

If app does not support Android Wear notifications, this is next best thing. It tries to improve formatting of inbox notifications (for example Gmail notification with multiple messages). It enables below options and generates notifications with a bit less clutter. It is recommended to keep this enabled unless notification looks weird on Pebble or is missing information. Android 4.1 or newer required.
Check this if app does not follow standards and displays new messages at the bottom instead of at the top.
Instead of displaying all the messages from the notification, display first one only.

Here you can define vibration pattern for this app. Pattern is in format \'vibrateTime, pauseTime, vibrateTime, pauseTime ...\', where times are in miliseconds. For example \'100, 200, 300\' will vibrate for 100ms, then wait 200 ms and then again vibrate for 300ms. Limit is 20 total numbers (so 10 vibrations and 10 pauses). Maximum total duration is 10 seconds. If you want to disable vibration, just enter 0.

After initial vibration, Pebble will also vibrate every few seconds to remind you notification is there in case you did not felt it first time or you were busy. Here you can set interval of that vibration. You can also set it to 0 to disable the feature.

Here you can define list of regular expressions that notification needs to contain in order for it to display on Pebble. If this list is empty, this setting is simply ignored. That option is very powerful so it is recommended that you google and learn about regular expressions first. But for basics, you can just enter any word here (case sensitive!) and it should match notification. For example if you enter \'Pebble\' (without quotes), it will only match notifications that contain \'Pebble\'.
Same as above, except that here all messages that contain specified expressions will NOT be sent to Pebble.
This setting is equal to checking app on the app list
Making new backup will delete any previously made backups. Do you want to proceed?
This action will replace whole Notification Center config with a backuped one. Do you want to proceed?
Error while restoring! Did you even make backup?
Use sub text for notification subtitle

Use text below message list for notification subtitle instead of actual notification title. Works better for standard-compilant apps (for example Gmail shows mail address instead of \'X new messages\').
Save notifications from this app to notification history

In this view you can enable/disable apps and edit settings for specific app (click on the app name to change its settings). Default settings are global settings and apply to every app unless you set different options on specific app and override defaults that way.
Load actions meant for Android Wear (actions that appear when you swipe left on Wear). This includes reply and regular actions.
Here you can define list of canned responses that you can reply with if app has Android Wear voice reply support.
%s\n\nPick correct text from menu or retry.

When this setting is enabled, you can dictate reply on android wear actions. Of course Pebble does not have microphone, but you can use your phone\'s mic (sometimes it even hears from your pocket) or mic on your headphones.

Instead of inbox notifications, display group notifications for Android Wear. This will display full individual messages instead of just displaying summary of your inbox when you receive multiple messages. Requires at least Android 4.3 or newer and app needs to implement Android Wear notifications for it to work.

Here you can add tasker tasks that will be added to that app\'s actions. When you select that task on the Pebble, tasker task will be executed. You need to enable external access in tasker to use this option.
Do you want to remove task %s from actions?

%s\n\n
Use retry from actions menu to retry voice input.

You can use those variables in task that is triggered by NC:

 %ncappname = name of the app that sent notification

 %ncappppkg = package of the app that sent notification

 %ncid = ID of the notification

 %nctag = Tag of the notification

 %nctitle = Title of the notification

 %ncsubtitle = Subtitle of the notification

 %nctext = Text of the notification

Intent triggered by NC will contain those extras:

 ncappname = name of the app that sent notification

 ncappppkg = package of the app that sent notification

 ncid = ID of the notification

 nctag = Tag of the notification

 nctitle = Title of the notification

 ncsubtitle = Subtitle of the notification

 nctext = Text of the notification
Tasker\'s External Access is turned off.

What happens when you press SELECT button on Pebble. Menu actions are equal to pressing corresponding action in action menu. For example if you pick \"Action menu item 3\" then pressing SELECT button would be equal to opening action menu and selecting 3rd action.
Same as above except that this actions is executed when you hold SELECT button.
Load notification actions that appear on the phone\'s notifications (buttons below notification text).
You need to install tasker to use this action.

Allows you to specify minimum amount of seconds that must pass between two notifications for second to vibrate. For example if you set this to 10 and you receive notification, it won\'t vibrate for notifications from this app for next 10 seconds. Useful for group chat notifications where lots of messages can be sent in very short time. Set to 0 to disable.

Allows you to specify minimum amount of seconds that must pass between two notifications for the second to be sent to Pebble. For example if you set this to 10 and you receive a notification, further notifications from this app won\'t be sent to Pebble for next 10 seconds. Useful for group chat notifications where lots of messages can be sent in very short time. Set to 0 to disable.
If \"Don\'t interrupt\" setting is enabled in your Android settings, notifications that are set to not interrupt you also won\'t be sent to the Pebble. Only works on Android 5.0 and newer.
When quiet hours are enabled, Pebble won\'t receive messages from this app in specified time.
Use this when you want to trigger something in tasker-like apps or other 3rd party apps that support intent events.
